this is pretty much psuedo story, to get the flow going and to familiarize myself with squiffy

the following produces this error

any idears (<-- thats a southern twang  :-)  )

>WARNING: null line 10: In section 'exploreOffice' there is a link to a passage called [officePainting], which doesn't exist
>WARNING: null line 10: In section 'exploreOffice' there is a link to a passage called [officeToolBox], which doesn't exist

>WARNING: null line 10: In section 'exploreOffice' there is a link to a passage called [officePowerCord], which doesn't exist
>WARNING: null line 10: In section 'exploreOffice' there is a link to a passage called [officeCoaxCable], which doesn't exist

```
[[continue]]:
inside the aprtment office, night time is here, unconcious [[Go back through the window and get out of here]](exitOfficeWindow), or [[wait the storm out, and explore the office]](exploreOffice)

[[exitOfficeWindow]]:
office window stuck

[[exploreOffice]]:
room size desc. [A large painting](officePainting) hangs on the east wall,some old [tools](officeToolBox) to one side. grabbing the center of attention, is the [office desk](officeDesk). a large oak desk, now mostly rotted, stands partnered with a broken, wooden chair at its side. an old [TV](officeTV)  hangs on wall. The [powercord](officePowerCord) hangs lifeless, [coax cable](officeCoaxCable)stil attached


[[officePainting]]:
adsfdsafadsf

[[officeToolBox]]:
adsfdsaf

[[officeDesk]]:
asdfdsafsa

[[officeTV]]:
adsfdsaf

[[officePowerCord]]:
adsfdsaf

[[officeCoaxCable]]:
adsfdsaf
```

room size desc. Posts.EditableText:
OK, I just figured it out (Im sooo impatient LOL). Ok I wanted a few of these items to stay "hot linked"
In order to make this work, I had to make the matching passage match the recieveing passage. 

So using the above as an example. I need to remove one of the bracket pairs (which I did), but I also have to do that belwo to the matching link so example to keep the TV link hot, i have to do
```
[TV](officeTV)
and
[officeTV]:
```
now it works keeping the TV hot

(in case anyone is curious why the links disappear, is so that readers cannot cheat an "go back" - but some times you have to keep a link hot for other reasons.

hopefully that helps someone

good video for this example helped me
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=axT08_w_f2w

OK, I just figured it out (Im sooo impatient LOL). Ok I wanted a few of these items to stay "hot linked"
In order to make this work, I had to make the matching passage match the recieveing passage.

So using the above as an example. I need to remove one of the bracket pairs (which I did), but I also have to do that belwo to the matching link so example to keep the TV link hot, i have to do

[TV](officeTV)
and
[officeTV]:

now it works keeping the TV hot

(in case anyone is curious why the links disappear, is so that readers cannot cheat an "go back" - but some times you have to keep a link hot for other reasons.

hopefully that helps someone

good video for this example helped me
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=axT08_w_f2w
